titlestmt.titleproper: Ford Foundation records, Peace and Social Justice Program (PSJ), Office Files of Natalia Kanem

did.unittitle: Ford Foundation records, Peace and Social Justice Program (PSJ), Office Files of Natalia Kanem

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Ford Foundation has title, copyright and literary rights in the collection, in so far as it holds them.

The Rockefeller Archive Center has authority to grant permission to cite and publish material from the collection. Permission to publish extensive excerpts, or material in its entirety, will be referred to the Ford Foundation.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: This material was transferred to the RAC in 2019 and was ingested by the RAC as Accession 2019:182.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Collection contains the office Files Natalia Kanem created and organized when she served as Deputy Vice President of the Ford Foundation's Peace and Social Justice Program (PSJ). It consists of one series of briefing books, reports, and various kinds of publications. The briefing books document Kanem's participation at different PSJ and larger Foundation meetings she attended between 2000 and 2004. Materials within the collection chiefly concern the state and development of civil society and peace and international cooperation throughout the world as well as the Foundation's support of research and programs focusing on those areas.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Natalia Kanem is a medical doctor who has worked in the fields of public health, reproductive health and sexuality, peace and international cooperation, and human rights and social justice. Her career encompasses positions in academia, philanthropy, and the United Nations. She held various posts at the Ford Foundation between 1992 and 2005 and is the current Executive Director of the United Nations Population Fund (UNFPA).

While at the Ford Foundation, Kanem's position changed from Program Officer for Women's Reproductive Health and Sexuality at the Lagos, Nigeria Office, to Representative for West Africa, to Senior Director of Management Services, to her final position as Deputy Vice President of the Peace and Social Justice Program (PSJ).

Kanem received a BA in history and science from Harvard University, an MD from Columbia University, and a Master's degree in public health with specializations in epidemiology and preventative medicine from the University of Washington. She joined the UNFPA in 2014 as the Country Representative for Tanzania, and then in 2016, she became Deputy Executive Director in charge of Programmes. She was appointed UNFPA Executive Director in 2017.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Series 1. Briefing books, reports, and publications, 2000-2004

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series contains the briefing books, reports, and various publications collected by Natalia Kanem between 2000 and 2004. Kanem served as Deputy Vice President of the Ford Foundation's Peace and Social Justice Program (PSJ) during this time, and the materials within the series chiefly concern the state and development of civil society and peace and international cooperation throughout the world as well as the Foundation's support of research and programs focusing on those areas. Kanem accumulated the briefing books in the series through her participation in different PSJ and larger Foundation meetings. The assortment of publications within the series include a directory and a book on civil society by Michael Edwards, Director of the Ford Foundation's Governance and Civil Society Unit (GCS).
